glsa.title: net-snmp: Authorization bypass
glsa.synopsis: A remote attacker can bypass the tcp-wrappers client authorization in net-snmp.

background.p: net-snmp bundles software for generating and retrieving SNMP data.

description.p: The netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr() function (snmplib/snmpUDPDomain.c), when using TCP wrappers for client authorization, does not properly parse hosts.allow rules.

impact.p: A remote, unauthenticated attacker could bypass the ACL filtering, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary SNMP queries.

workaround.p: If possible, protect net-snmp with custom iptables rules:
workaround.code: iptables -s [client] -d [host] -p udp --dport 161 -j ACCEPT iptables -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d [host] -p udp --dport 161 -j DROP

resolution.p: All net-snmp users should upgrade to the latest version:
